discussion.content: Software as a service (or SaaS) is a way of delivering applications over the Internet—as a service. Instead of installing and maintaining software, you simply access it via the Internet, freeing yourself from complex software and hardware management.
I’d guess cuz the provider manages the software as a service so no need for end user patching or upgrade

questions.question_text: Which of the following cloud models would MOST likely be described as a service in which the customer has no responsibility for application patching?
Which of the following cloud-based services gives customers the ability to scale resources as needed?

discussion.content: Rapid Elasticity - The ability to dynamically scale services being provided in direct response to the need of customers for space and other services. This is one of the five fundamental aspects of cloud computing.

questions.question_text:
A technician is troubleshooting a networking issue for a client. After running ipconfig/all the technician discovers the IP address assigned to the computer is
169.254.100.58.
Which of the following network configurations does this describe?

discussion.content: Ok I get it now. 169.254 …is a hint at APIPA.
Why not dhcp? It says the computer was assigned this IP address implying that it didn’t assign itself an IP addy

Automatic Private IP Addressing (APIPA) is a feature of Windows-based operating systems (included in Windows 98, ME, 2000, and XP) that enables a computer to automatically assign itself an IP address when there is no Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server available to perform that function.

USB-C is often used with camera equipment, peripherals, and more and more on the market. They're use to connect and charge and a great tool. It's awesome to have one handy in case someone needs to connect something but forgot one! Put it in yopur toolbox :D
"Non-directional" refers to how USB-C can be connected from either side. Previous USB types must be connected one particular way.
No direccional hace referencia al tipo de conector C?

questions.question_text: Which of the following charging and data ports has a non-directional connector?

discussion.content: I think it's because it is a thin client, that the most common answer is going to Saas.

Selected Answer: B
A strange misleading question.
"A company wants to use thin clients to run all the common business applications it uses."
"a common e-mail domain" "share files" 

It has local applications if i interpret it correctly, hire server resources to configure and install your local applications, IaaS should be it. 

It does not say anything about cloud or browser applications.
I think it is IaaS, the word "application" is likely a distraction to make you think it is SaaS.

Some websites says its PAAS but i think SAAS is the correct answer here. 
PAAS = Application development.
your not developing anything here or using an infrastructure to do something.

comments.content:
But wouldn't software as a service only provide access to one piece of software? Typically SAAS is accessed through a web browser. I would guess IAAS is the correct answer here as they are not only using cloud resources to share files but also manage emails.
Sources SAAS: https://searchcloudcomputing.techtarget.com/definition/Software-as-a-Service
Sources IAAS: https://www.gartner.com/en/information-technology/glossary/infrastructure-as-a-service-iaas#:~:text=Infrastructure%20as%20a%20service%20(IaaS)%20is%20a%20standardized%2C%20highly,time%20and%20metered%20by%20use.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to use thin clients to run all the common business applications it uses. The users need to share files and have a common email domain.
Which of the following cloud concepts should a technician recommend?
